metadata.title: CVE-2021-3655 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel in versions prior tov5.14-rc1. Missing size validations on inbound SCTP packets may allow thekernel to read uninitialized memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-generic - 4.15.0-162.170
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-162-lowlatency - 4.15.0-162.170
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-91-generic - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-91-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-91-lowlatency - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-91-lowlatency - 5.4.0-91.102~18.04.1
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-162.170').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
